tasks: Create a simple wireframe of a login form using the 8-point grid system, focusing on error states (e.g., incorrect password). Referencing your score gap in UX Fundamentals: 14/100. (1 hour)

Conduct 1 user interview and document 3 pain points using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework, focusing on Collaboration & Communication skills. Referencing your score gap in Collaboration & Communication: 18/100. (1 hour)

Create a list of 5 usability heuristics for user interface design, referencing the nngroup.com resource. Focus on applying these principles to your existing designs. Referencing your score gap in UX Fundamentals: 14/100. (1 hour)

Redesign a simple product or service using the Laws of UX, focusing on Aesthetic-Usability Effect and Zeigarnik Effect principles. Referencing your score gap in UX Fundamentals: 14/100 and Collaboration & Communication: 18/100. (2 hours)

resources.readup: As an Explorer UX designer, you have the unique opportunity to craft intuitive and user-centered experiences that drive meaningful interactions. By leveraging your skills in research, strategy, and collaboration, you can uncover innovative solutions that delight users and leave a lasting impact.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Understanding Usability Heuristics for UI Design
topics.summary: Applying usability heuristics will help Explorer designers improve user interface design and create a more intuitive experience.
practice_points: Analyze 3 existing websites using the 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design and identify areas for improvement
Create a comprehensive guide to applying the Law of Proximity in UI design, including examples and best practices

topics.name: Aesthetic-Usability Effect: Visual Design Principles
topics.summary: Exploring the Aesthetic-Usability Effect will help Explorer designers create visually appealing and user-friendly designs.
practice_points: Design 3 wireframes for a hypothetical product using the Aesthetic-Usability Effect principles to guide visual design decisions

topics.name: Conducting User Research with the Jobs-to-be-Done Framework
topics.summary: Using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework will help Explorer designers gain a deeper understanding of user needs and behaviors.
practice_points: Conduct 2 interviews using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework to understand user motivations and pain points for a specific product or service

insights.detailed: The score of 14 indicates that the Explorer designer needs to focus on developing a solid understanding of user-centered design principles, such as user research, wireframing, and usability testing. This will help create an intuitive and accessible experience for users.
actionable: Conduct user research to understand user pain points and behaviors
Create low-fidelity wireframes to visualize the information architecture
Test prototypes with real users to gather feedback and iterate on design

insights.brief: Score meaning for UI Craft & Visual Design
insights.detailed: The score of 22 indicates that the Explorer designer needs to focus on developing a strong visual language, including typography, color palette, and imagery. This will help create a visually appealing and cohesive experience for users.
actionable: Develop a consistent typography system across all screens
Create a color palette that aligns with the brand's identity
Use high-quality images that support the content and message

insights.brief: Score meaning for User Research & Validation
insights.detailed: The score of 22 indicates that the Explorer designer needs to focus on validating assumptions through user research and testing. This will help ensure that the design meets user needs and expectations.
actionable: Conduct usability testing with real users to validate design decisions
Create user personas to guide research and testing efforts
Use A/B testing to validate design hypotheses

insights.brief: Score meaning for Product Thinking & Strategy
insights.detailed: The score of 29 indicates that the Explorer designer needs to focus on developing a deep understanding of the product's goals, target audience, and market trends. This will help create a product that meets user needs and stays competitive in the market.
actionable: Develop a product roadmap that aligns with business objectives
Conduct competitor analysis to identify market gaps and opportunities
Create customer journey maps to understand user behavior and pain points

insights.detailed: The score of 18 indicates that the Explorer designer needs to focus on improving collaboration and communication with stakeholders, including designers, developers, and product managers. This will help ensure that everyone is aligned on design decisions and goals.
actionable: Schedule regular design reviews with cross-functional teams
Create a shared design language guide for consistency across projects
Use collaboration tools to facilitate feedback and iteration
